Hi Misty, thanks for the great feedback! Some of the messages on reverse playback are very clear. This one might be one of Frank's guys looking in.
"Circuit made manual"
Thanks again,
Dave

--- bulletbabea@... wrote:

From: Misty Dawn <bulletbabea@...>
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Sweep Tuning of AM Radio Band
Date: Mon, 19 Mar 2007 19:02:04 -0700 (PDT)

Wow Dave cool evp. Whats really cool is when I reverse that it says "your in the zone"
   
  plug a million hertz
  your in the zone
   
  Thats what I hear. That actually has reference for something Laura and I were talking about recently so thanks for the "plug" and sharing that! 
   
  Misty

RetroCom <vfp19968@...> wrote:
          
I have a very sensitive old AM tuner with a flywheel tuning system. I tried several recording sessions manually sweeping the tuner through the AM band late at night. I got pretty good at keeping the dial moving at a constant rate of speed. This is not nearly as good as Frank's 'hands off' random tuning method but it still produced some results. What impressed me most is that some of the voices sound the same, even though I tuned through several channels. This attached capture could be a technical message.
"Plug a million hertz" One Million Hertz = 1mhz = 1000khz, which is close the center frequency for the AM broadcast band.
Dave
